        Parameters:

      • getAutoCommit

        public static final boolean getAutoCommit()
        Get the default auto-commit for all connections returned from LexUtil
        Returns:
        true = auto commit, false = rollback

      • getDatabaseConnection

        public static final java.sql.Connection getDatabaseConnection()
                                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Get a connection from the VersaLex database connection pool.
        A connection is returned even if the connection poolsize is being exceeded.
        Returns:
        database connection
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getDatabaseConnection

        public static final java.sql.Connection getDatabaseConnection(boolean commit)
                                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Get a connection from the VersaLex database connection pool.
        A connection is returned even if the connection poolsize is being exceeded.
        Parameters:
        commit - passing in a boolean overrides the default. true returns an auto commit connection, false returns a rollback connection
        Returns:
        database connection
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • putDatabaseConnection

        public static final void putDatabaseConnection(java.sql.Connection connection)
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Put back a database connection into the VersaLex connection pool.
        For proper cleanup, even a closed or otherwise invalid connection should be put back.
        In order to avoid potentially creating new connections over and over, an excessive connection is closed and removed from the pool only after an unused period has elapsed (20 minutes).
        Parameters:
        connection - database connection being returned to pool
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • putDatabaseConnection

        public static final void putDatabaseConnection(java.sql.Connection connection,
                                               boolean commit)
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Put back a database connection into the VersaLex connection pool.
        For proper cleanup, even a closed or otherwise invalid connection should be put back.
        In order to avoid potentially creating new connections over and over, an excessive connection is closed and removed from the pool only after an unused period has elapsed (20 minutes).
        Parameters:
        connection - database connection being returned to pool
        commit - if connection.getAutoCommit() returns false, then passing true will commit the connection before adding it back to the pool. If connection.getAutoCommit() returns false and commit is false, then the connection is rolled back before returning to the pool
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setDatabaseConnectionPoolSize

        public static final void setDatabaseConnectionPoolSize(int poolsize)
                                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Set the database connection poolsize (defaults to 1).
        Parameters:
        poolsize - (must be >= 1)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
